name: React
description: React has been my frontend framework of choice for the last few years. I have experience with both class-based and functional components, as well as hooks. I have also worked with Redux and Context API for state management.

name: Node.js
description: Node.js is my backend runtime of choice. Most of the time, I've used it with Express, but I've also worked with Fastify. I also have experience using it to build RESTful APIs and GraphQL servers.

name: MongoDB
description: MongoDB is the database I've used the most. I have experience with both the native MongoDB driver and Mongoose. I've used it to build RESTful APIs and GraphQL servers.

name: Express
description: Express is the backend framework I've used the most. I have experience building RESTful APIs and GraphQL servers with it.

name: JavaScript
description: JavaScript is the language I've used the most. I have experience with both ES5 and ES6, as well as TypeScript. I've used it to build frontend and backend applications.

name: TypeScript
description: TypeScript is the language I've used the most in the last few years. I have experience with both frontend and backend applications.

name: Golang
description: Golang is a language I've used sparingly, but I have experience building/maintaining a service using it from my time at Qualtrics.

name: Python
description: Python is a language I've used for a few projects. I used it quite a bit a few years ago. While at Qualtrics, I built an image comparison library for testing purposes in Python. More recently, I picked it up again to build a text analysis service.
projects: A text analysis service for Mock My Draft

name: Docker
description: Docker is a tool I've used for a few projects. I have experience building and running containers. I've also used it to build multi-container applications, such as a full-stack applications with multiple backend services, multiple frontend apps, and a database.
projects: A few projects while at Qualtrics

name: Git
description: Git is the version control system I've used the most. I have experience with both GitHub and GitLab (and even BitBucket once upon a time). I've used it for both personal and professional projects.
projects: Basically every software project I've worked on

name: Jest
description: Jest is the testing framework I've used the most for recent projects. I have experience writing unit tests and integration tests with it.

name: Vue
description: Vue is a frontend framework I've used for a few projects, although not as much recently.
projects: A small company website for a dog breeder

name: D3.js
description: D3.js has been my go to library for data visualization over the last several years. I used it extensively in my time at Qualtrics to build a visualization library that was used by many teams and enabled the platform's reporting capabilities.

name: SQL
description: I've used SQL for a few projects when they've called for relational databases. I have experience writing queries and building schemas, mostly used with Postgres.

name: Rust
description: Rust is a language I haven't used much, but I've been learning it in my free time. I hope to use it for a project in the near future.

name: Svelte
description: Svelte is a frontend framework I've used occasionally in recent years for very small personal projects. I especially like how well it works for data visualization.

name: Elm
description: Elm is a frontend language I've used a little bit. I like the functional programming paradigm it uses, but I haven't used it much in recent years. I would love to explore using it for a larger scale project in the future.
